div.l: I sall be holden a daf and a cokenay
I woll arise and auntre it by my feith
Vnhardy is vnsely thus men seith
And vp he roos / and softly he went
Vn to the cradle / and in his hond it hent
And bare it soft vn to his beddes fete
Sone after this the wyf hir routyng lete
And gan̄ awake and went hir out to pisse
And cam̄ agayn̄ / and can̄ hir cradle mysse
And groped here and there / and she fond noon̄
Allas koth she / I hade all most mysgoon̄
I hade all most goon̄ to the clerkes bedde
Ey benedicite than hade I foule spedde
And forth she goth tyll she þe cradle fonde
She gropeth all wey ferther͗e wᵗith hir honde
And fonde the bedde / and thought nat but gode
By cause that the cradle by it stode
And nyst where she was for it was derk
But fayre and wele she crape in by þe clerk
And lith full still and wold haue caught a slepe
Wᵗith in a while this Iohn the clerk vp lepe
And on̄ this gode wyf he leid on̄ sore
So mery a fitte hade she nat full yore
He prikketh harde and depe as he were mad
This ioly lyf han̄ þise ·ij· clerkes lad
Tyll that the ·iijᵈᵉ cok bygan̄ to syng
Aleyn̄ wax wery in the mornyng
For he had swonken̄ all þe long nyght
And seid fare wele Malkyn̄ swete wight
The day is com̄ I may no lenger abide
But eủermore where so I go or ride
I is thyn̄ owen̄ Clerk so haue I sele
Now dere lemman koth she go fare wele
But or þᵘou go / o thyng I woll thee tell
Whan þat þᵘou wendest homward by þe mell
Right at the entre of the dore behynde
Þᵘou shalt a Cake of a busshell fynde
That was ymaked of thyn̄ owen̄ mele
Whych þat I help my self for to stele
And gode lemman god the save and kepe
And wᵗith that worde all most she gan̄ to wepe
